acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Alan Cheuse of Fairfax, Virginia, placed his papers on loan to the Library on September 20, 1995. The papers were purchased by the Library on September 11, 2003.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: These additions to the papers of Alan Cheuse, American novelist and reviewer, ca. 300 items (3 Hollinger boxes, 2 linear feet), 1991-1995, consist of manuscripts of books and short stories by Alan Cheuse, personal and professional correspondence, printed material, invitations to literary events and conferences, book reviews, an appointment book for 1994, two cassette tape recordings, and manuscripts of short stories of other authors to be used on the radio program The Sound of Writing.

Correspondents and topics include: John W. Subjects include: Cliff Jackson and Bill Clinton (1994 Jun 13); Bernard Malamud (1994 Jun 13); Eric Pankey article re transcendence "To Repair the Material of Experience" (see also Cheuse's article in this collection, "Dog Spelled Backward") (1994 Jun 22, Sep 12); "The Mexican Maid" by Alan Cheuse (1994 Jul 18); Rowing in Eden by Alan Cheuse (1994 Jul 20); article by Victor Perera re politics of Guatemala 1994 Sep 22; Paula Gover's White Boys and River Girlsback jacket blurb (1994 Nov 1)
